title: Australia for UNHCR
subtitle:
"We want documents for Rohingya. This is our document,” says Nasima who recently received an official identity card.

Since June 2018, UNHCR has registered over 500,000 Rohingya refugees using biometric technology. It's a step towards a more dignified life for Rohingya refugees. pic.twitter.com/mCBevUUyKw

title: Migrant Rescue Watch
subtitle: Italian Transport Minister offers to take all #migrants to Spain & demands immediate removal of Spanish flag from #OpenArms vessel! #migrantcrisis #Frontex #LibyanCoastGuard #UNHCR #Refugees #Seenotrettung #LibyscheKüstenwache #BackAtSea #EU Source: https://www.facebook.com/danilotoninelli.m5s/ …pic.twitter.com/FnFg6TOrso

title: Zena Chamas
subtitle: Dozens are in Melbourne to show support to the Tamil refugee family who face deportation. They chanted “Let them stay” #Biloela #letThemStay more via @AAPNewswirepic.twitter.com/4W2XOlASaH

title: The University of Auckland
subtitle: For the first time, the Students from Refugee Backgrounds Club on campus have pulled together a week of activities and events to celebrate refugees and the NGOs which support them. Start the week by grabbing some lunch for koha at the fundraising BBQ in the Quad tomorrow. pic.twitter.com/L6junhhgft

title: Isobel Roe
subtitle:
This story flawed me. Refugee legal services struggle to help 30,000 refugees called the 'legacy caseload', created by a policy change several years ago. Meanwhile the legal services had their funding cut. Listen here:
#refugees @RACSaustralia
https://www.abc.net.au/radio/programs/am/refugee-legal-services-struggle-to-help-legacy-caseload-backlog/11444952 …pic.twitter.com/GRnx2ydJ2b

title: People Just Like Us
subtitle: ⁦#HARK19 #Medevac ⁦@drkerrynphelps⁩ & ⁦@Craig_Foster⁩ tell us that refugee rights are about us not them. It’s about our souls - about who we are pic.twitter.com/YX9g1TFdFE

title: People Just Like Us
subtitle: @drkerrynphelps campaigned and explained the history and the future of the Medevac Bill at the 2019 Paediatric Refugee Health Conference. #hark19 #refugee #health #medevacbillpic.twitter.com/y3aqPNCMnB – at The Children's Hospital At Westmead

title: David Hume Kennerly
subtitle: Four years ago today @NickKennerly entertained Syrian refugee kids at Za'atari Camp near the Syrian border. The place held close to 90,000 refugees and opened seven years ago to accommodate civilians fleeing the fighting. They loved Nick, and he was happy to bring them joy. pic.twitter.com/CEeFf11GXz

title: Felicity Gray
subtitle: Ibi on her book:  the “destructive consequences of democracies relying on institutional processes that are deaf to human needs”. Our government needs to *listen* to the needs of refugee migrants, and it just doesn’t. #auspolpic.twitter.com/6LkarLhYd8

title: Peter McMullin Centre on Statelessness
subtitle: Wonderful seminar today by @ibi2020 @MelbLawSchool as part of the #Migration, #Refugees & #Statelessness Seminar Series. Thanks to Ibi and to our partners @MSEI_UniMelb for another fantastic event.pic.twitter.com/SWlPfhp7jY

title: Naomi Steer
subtitle:
This new study shows hiring refugee women and paying them a fair wage could boost global GDP by US$1.4 trillion. This backs up what we’ve seen in the field, refugee participation in the labour market is a powerful force. #WithRefugees #RefugeesWelcome
http://ow.ly/HZiE50vBzKx pic.twitter.com/1HBzm8bnY1

title: Multiculture Vic
subtitle: Amazing scholarship opportunity for people from refugee backgrounds: #Study the 3-year Bachelor of Arts program at the prestigious @AFTRS in Sydney from 2020 with paid tuition and some living expenses! If you're a #refugee #creative, apply by 3 September! https://bit.ly/2zaBBQf pic.twitter.com/HxrEmnmnxt

title: Multicultural Arts Victoria
subtitle: @multiartsvic & @immigration_mv are partnering to present Generations, a multi-generational, multidisciplinary platform for artists from migrant, refugee and asylum seekers backgrounds to engage in public discourse around multiculturalism and migration > http://bit.ly/generations-eoi pic.twitter.com/OVnCD8Pmp0

title: Naomi Steer
subtitle:
Really enjoyed recording this interview with the Good Will Hunters podcast about the work we fund globally, how we work to tell refugee stories, refugee entrepreneurship, the power of women supporting women and a whole lot more. #WithRefugees
